User

User - Read data of a User

  • compare changes to:
  • 0.3.0
  • 0.2.0
  • 0.1.0

Compare Verison 0.3.0 with 0.2.0 and you will see the green markers with new items in version 0.3.0 and red markers with removed items since 0.2.0.

/user/:id

Permission: admin  

  • Example usage: 
curl -i http://localhost/user/4711

Parameter

Field Type Description
id String

The Users-ID.

Success 200

Field Type Description
id String

The Users-ID.
registered Date

Registration Date.
name Date

Fullname of the User.
nicknames String[]

List of Users nicknames (Array of Strings).
profile Object

Profile data (example for an Object)
  age Number

Users age.
  image String

Avatar-Image.
options Object[]

List of Users options (Array of Objects).
  name String

Option Name.
  value String

Option Value.

Error 4xx

Field Description
NoAccessRight

Only authenticated Admins can access the data.
UserNotFound

The id of the User was not found.
  • Response (example): 
    HTTP/1.1 401 Not Authenticated
    {
      "error": "NoAccessRight"
    }

Send a Sample Request

> url

Parameters

Parameter

> String

Response

User - Create a new User

  • compare changes to:
  • 0.3.0
  • 0.2.0

In this case "apiUse" is defined and used. Define blocks with params that will be used in several functions, so you dont have to rewrite them.

/user

Permission: none

Parameter

Field Type Description
name String

Name of the User.

Success 200

Field Type Description
id String

The new Users-ID.

Error 4xx

Field Description
NoAccessRight

Only authenticated Admins can access the data.
UserNameTooShort

Minimum of 5 characters required.
  • Response (example): 
    HTTP/1.1 400 Bad Request
    {
      "error": "UserNameTooShort"
    }

User - Create a User

  • compare changes to:
  • 0.3.0
  • 0.2.0

In this case "apiUse" is defined and used. Define blocks with params that will be used in several functions, so you dont have to rewrite them.

Permission: none

Field Type Description

Name of the User.

Field Type Description

The Users-ID.

Field Description

Only authenticated Admins can access the data.

    HTTP/1.1 400 Bad Request
    {
      "error": "UserNameTooShort"
    }

User - Change a new User

  • compare changes to:
  • 0.3.0

This function has same errors like POST /user, but errors not defined again, they were included with "apiUse"

/user/:id

Permission: none

Parameter

Field Type Description
name String

Name of the User.

Error 4xx

Field Description
NoAccessRight

Only authenticated Admins can access the data.
UserNameTooShort

Minimum of 5 characters required.
  • Response (example): 
    HTTP/1.1 400 Bad Request
    {
      "error": "UserNameTooShort"
    }
